Reviews.Title: Best $190 Spent in a Long Time
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I really had no intention of replacing my 28" CRT, but when I saw this model on sale at such a low price, I decided to give flat screens a try.  A larger screen wasn't an option for me anyway since I live overseas and needed my friend to bring it down for me, so it needed to be reasonably small.  It survived the shipping and United flight with no damage at all.I've had the TV for 3 or 4 days and have to say that I'm incredibly impressed.  The viewing area is not that much less than my old 28" CRT TV.  The picture quality is great, the remote is easy to use, it was easy to update the TV's software, it works great with my notebook via HDMI cable to stream internet programs/movies and youtube videos.  Very cool. I won't comment on the audio because I don't listen to the audio through the TV speakers.NOW . . . here's a tip for anybody that might want to connect this TV to a traditional stereo receiver (maybe I'm the only one who would bother since I use this small unit in a small living room)--and if your sound system is NOT home theater and does NOT have any HDMI cable inputs (such as the Yamaha RX-397 receiver):Almost all the traditional (RCA) connections on this TV, including audio, are inputs--not outputs--and you may conclude that there is no way you can get the sound out of the TV and into both your receiver/stereo speakers.  There are two solutions: 1) instead of plugging the cable that you use to connect your MP3 player to your stereo, plug it into the TV's side-mounted headphone jack instead Monster THXIMINI8 THX Certified 1/8 Stereo to Stereo RCA Cable Adapteror 2) connect a similar cable to the TV's single digital sound output (except instead of a 1/8 stereo mini plug, you would have a single RCA plug into the TV). [[RCA Male to Two RCA Male Y-Cable]]With that audio work around, I really have no complaints at all and highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Philips 22" TV
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a bedroom. Just the right size. The picture is good for this size tv. Not as good as my Sony 32" but then I didn't think it would, but at 1/3 the price I am definately happy with it. The sound is fine for a bedroom with no complaints. Somehow my original order got damaged in transit and was flagged by UPS. I reordered and Amazon gave me $10 off for the delay. Made this purchase even better. Reviews.Title: Very nice!

Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for use in my kitchen. It is the right size for the small kitchen. The picture is very clear and volume is fine for the kitchen. I would definitely buy the same one again.

Reviews.Title: Very good LCD tv
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: fun game very immersive gameplay and graphics are brilliant. get it for nothing from controls are easy to learn and onlnie play is competitive for better players.

Reviews.Title: Philips 22PFL4505D/F7 22-Inch 720p LED LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: W. Raisch "Bill Raisch"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV long enough to use it awhile and I love it! I bought it for my bedroom and it does everything I need a TV for! I've read some reviews saying the sound was not good. Reviews.Title: Nice TV!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Allen
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my children's room; they are 4 and 2 years old. I love the performance of this TV. Don't hesitate to buy; a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little TV.
Reviews.Author: Griffin
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic value for a 22" LED backlit hdtv. I bought this to replace my old tube tv which died after a lightening strike. The design and form factor is very nice. I love the clear strip around the bezel and the white led light that lights up when it is powered on. This is the first time I have seen a USB port on a TV. I used it to charge my phone and it worked fine. The picture quality is very good when watching digital/HD channels. I plugged in my computer using HDMI and it works great. There is a tiny bit of lag because of the 8ms response time but other then that, I use it to extend my screen real estate from my laptop. Overall, this TV is great, lots of connectivity options, great picture, and fairly good sound. Hopefully it will provide me with entertainment for years to come.

Reviews.Title: Good HDTV

Reviews.Content: Easy to setup and use.  Nice picture quality.  Sound is a bit tinny but otherwise a great value.

Reviews.Title: Perfect small TV.
Reviews.Author: Chemist
Reviews.Content: I am using this TV 1.5 months and like it very much.It cost me only $189.00 and this is perfect TV for my kitchen.Easy to install, easy to control and good colors and sound.So far I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great 22 inch
Reviews.Author: Animekd3
Reviews.Content: This product was easy to install and setup. the hd quality is pretty good however you need to toggle with the color settings a bit.

Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as an upgrade for the bedroom. Reviews.Content: I am using this tv in the kitchen, mainly for news. It is on an air antenna and I get a great picture. For what I use it for, it is great. Reviews.Title: Good picture, screen size is between 20 and 20.8 at most, REALLY bad sound,
Reviews.Author: Joseph P.
Reviews.Content: With flat panel displays, it's the norm that when you say a screen is 22 inches, that its viewable diagonal distance is indeed is 22 inches. This screen is a little over 20 inches. Maybe not a big deal if you're talking about larger screens, and even then the dishonesty would be annoying. But with a small display, the difference is significant. Deceptive marketing pisses me off, and Amazon should correct their description accordingly.I read other reviews about the sound quality, so I was prepared for pretty bad sound. I don't know if it's typical of sets this small, as I've never owned a flat panel tv of this size, but the sound is indeed terrible. Separate computer speakers are pretty much essential. To say this tv sounds like it's utilizing tin can technology, is an insult to tin cans.The picture quality is good for the price you're paying. Good contrast, good colors. My other 46 inch samsung is a few years old, that's all I can really compare this against.I'm thinking about returning this. At $180, it still seems a good buy. I don't see much on the market that compares. It sits about 6 feet from my PC, I'm trying to see if I can find something so that I can get the PC speakers to play the TV's sound without having to disconnect and reconnect the cords.Amazon, as always, did a fantastic job in terms of shipping. Just wish they'd verify the actual screen size and put that info in bold on the product description.

I do not have a car at this time so I liked the idea of  it being delivered, especially for free.  It was properly protected by its foam inserts, although I do believe the outside box should be somewhat heavier.  That is Amazon.com's problem.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: N. Breuer

Reviews.Content: I bought this set for a bedroom. First off the sound is terrible, and the set is too small. I tried adjusting the color, sharpness, contrast and picture is blurry. Reviews.Author: J.D "J.D"
Reviews.Content: It's just a tv. No special bells and whistles. The picture quality is as good as expected. It works and it's cheap. I'd recommend it if that's what you're looking for. Works for me.

Reviews.Title: Missing one BIG feature!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Many other people have covered both the video and audio quality of this TV, so I won't bother repeating them.  What does need mentioned, however is the lack of a feature that has become an industry standard, and ultimately was the reason for my returning this item:It has no internal clock.That means that you cannot set automatic on/off times for the TV.  All that they give you is a sleep timer, and even that only maxes at 120 minutes.We bought this as a bedroom TV and found that it was lacking in the one feature which it actually needed for that purpose.  It might not be a deal-breaker for some, but it needs to be mentioned, just in case it might be.

Reviews.Content: I returned this set because the picture was quite a bit smaller than the screen size and it did not receive sound on several channels.  However, the quality of the picture was good.

Reviews.Content: I received the Phillips 22 inch for my sewing room.  I wanted a nice tv in there but didn't want it to cost a fortune.  It has a good picture but isn't as good as our Panasonic. I like it but for more use I would purchase a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: There are much better TV's out there
Reviews.Author: Ricus
Reviews.Content: How can I sum up my feelings about this TV...... Disapointing would be the first thing I think of. I feel that this TV could not be used in a brightly lit room because the picture backlight was very dim and the colors very muted so the light in the room could easily overcome the bightness of the TV display. I did my best to "Customize" the picture to try to correct the dimly lit screen but I was not successful in improving the picture quality. I then put this Philips LED HDTV beside a 4 year old 46" Sony LCD and my old Sony looked brighter and it had more intense color(s) than this Philips LED TV even after 4 years of use. The Philips TV construction was good and the sound was better than most TV's this size and the display tilted also which was unexpected, however the picture quality I felt was poor so thanks to Amazon, I was able to return it promptly.

Reviews.Author: FroggyM
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv about 1.5 months ago.  When I first started using it, I was immediately disappointed with the quality of the image (only ok/crappy, not great) and the sound (totally dreadful).  The sound is so bad that you _must_ plug in external speakers.  Anyway, this is a bedroom tv that I don't watch that often, so I decided to just keep it. I've always been weary of off-brands (e.g. Element, Vizio, Emerson, etc.) when it comes to technology, so I thought I'd opt for the safe choice in a name like Philips, especially since it was almost as affordable as the off-brands and highly rated. The picture is acceptable but a bit grainy and nothing compared to the two Samsung TVs I own. If I were shopping for a TV again, I would either pay the extra money and spring for a quality brand, like a Samsung or LG, or just go with an off-brand, because this Philips offers the worst of both worlds - relatively high cost and relatively poor quality.
